intro: Callista sumneri, commonly known as the Sumner's callista, is a flowering plant native to New Zealand. It belongs to the family Campanulaceae and is characterized by its bell-shaped, blue or purple flowers. The plant typically grows in coastal areas and is adapted to sandy or gravelly soils. It has narrow, linear leaves and produces showy inflorescences that attract pollinators. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
